newsitem.title: USA: BellSouth gets major stake in Ecuadorean co.
newsitem.headline: BellSouth gets major stake in Ecuadorean co.

text.p: BellSouth Corp said Tuesday that it bought a 61 percent interest in OTECEL, one of two nationwide wireless telephone companies in Ecuador, by buying all the shares of the company's two largest shareholders, Planer Overseas Corp and Discovery Inc.

BellSouth said OTECEL began service under a nationwide license in 1994 and serves more than 30,000 customers with a network covering all the country's major cities. It has more than 50 percent marketshare in Ecuador and its license allows it to provide national and international long distance service to its wireless subscribers, BellSouth said.
BellSouth said Ecuador is now the eighth country it serves in Latin America.
"With its very low penetration of both landline and cellular service, Ecuador provides the kind of opportunity we have pursued across Latin America," BellSouth said in a release.
